courses.title: Learn Python: The Complete Python Programming Course
courses.smallDescription: Learn A-Z everything about Python, from the basics, to advanced topics like Python GUI, Python Data Analysis, and more!
courses.author: Avinash Jain,The Codex

instructors.name: Avinash Jain
instructors.job: CEO of TheCodex.me - Teaching 500,000+ Students how to code
instructors.description:
Avinash Jain is currently a senior at UC Berkeley majoring in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. He's the CEO and Founder of TheCodex, an online educational platform focused on bringing the best programming content to hundreds of thousands of students around the world.

His programming journey began at the age of 10, starting off with simple Python scripts to crawl the weather. Since then, he's worked at numerous companies and is professionally experienced in Python, iOS Development and Web Development. He's launched a plethora of applications in the App Store amassing thousands of downloads. Additionaly, he's competed and won in several hackathons around the world including PennApps and NWHacks.

Avinash has a passion to teach - his enthusiasm and love for programming is evident in every video. For the past 7 years he's been an instructor on Udemy and he loves motivating and enabling others to pursue their programming dreams. He hopes to help students realize the power of programming and jumpstart their careers through his courses.

Checkout TheCodex for all of his courses, fantastic discounts, and any guidance or help. 

Show less

instructors.name: The Codex
instructors.description:
You've taken a lengthy and boring coding class, but you're clueless about applying these concepts to build your ideas. The Codex shows you how to build fun, practical projects. Now, you can stand out from the crowd and land your dream job.




Join us on our platform today!







Show less

courses.description:
Do you want to become a programmer? Do you want to learn how to create games, automate your browser, visualize data, and much more?
If you’re looking to learn Python for the very first time or need a quick brush-up, this is the course for you!
Python has rapidly become one of the most popular programming languages around the world. Compared to other languages such as Java or C++, Python consistently outranks and outperforms these languages in demand from businesses and job availability. The average Python developer makes over $100,000 - this number is only going to grow in the coming years.
The best part? Python is one of the easiest coding languages to learn right now. It doesn’t matter if you have no programming experience or are unfamiliar with the syntax of Python. By the time you finish this course, you'll be an absolute pro at programming!
This course will cover all the basics and several advanced concepts of Python. We’ll go over:
  • The fundamentals of Python programming
  • The fundamentals of Python programming
  • The fundamentals of Python programming
  • The fundamentals of Python programming

If you read the above list and are feeling a bit confused, don’t worry! As an instructor and student on Udemy for almost 4 years, I know what it’s like to be overwhelmed with boring and mundane. I promise you’ll have a blast learning the ins and outs of python. I’ve successfully taught over 200,000+ students from over 200 countries jumpstart their programming journeys through my courses.
Here’s what some of my students have to say:
  • “I wish I started programming at a younger age like Avi. This Python course was excellent for those that cringe at the thought of starting over from scratch with attempts to write programs once again. Python is a great building language for any beginner programmer. Thank you Avi!”

reviews.content:
The sound is subpar. The majority of the time, I played at MAX volume. Although the content is extremely basic, I learned a lot.
Thank you very much!
reviews.content_html:
The sound is subpar. The majority of the time, I played at MAX volume. Although the content is extremely basic, I learned a lot.
Thank you very much!

reviews.content: Well Done .The Comparison of PostgreSQL and MS SQL very Useful. Easy to Understand and never forget the basic concepts Thank you Staffs.
reviews.content_html: Well Done .The Comparison of PostgreSQL and MS SQL very Useful. Easy to Understand and never forget the basic concepts Thank you Staffs.

reviews.content: Me recomendaron este curso en mi formación como técnico de soporte y, la verdad, es que es muy completo y muy bien explicado y las prácticas que proponen son un  plus
reviews.content_html: Me recomendaron este curso en mi formación como técnico de soporte y, la verdad, es que es muy completo y muy bien explicado y las prácticas que proponen son un plus

reviews.content: It is a great course for understanding fundamental and compulsory concepts for kicking a start in the world of databases.
reviews.content_html: It is a great course for understanding fundamental and compulsory concepts for kicking a start in the world of databases.

reviews.content:
Wow, Amazing Course 
Everything is explained so nicely.
reviews.content_html:
Wow, Amazing Course
Everything is explained so nicely.

reviews.content: All the course was informmative and easy to understand and the no of questions and worries have are high but this course helped me in clearing those worries and this course is worth the time if anyone want to try.
reviews.content_html: All the course was informmative and easy to understand and the no of questions and worries have are high but this course helped me in clearing those worries and this course is worth the time if anyone want to try.

reviews.content: I was hoping more in-depth data modeling and real challenge. This was pretty basic course. Section 9 was something that I was looking for more.
reviews.content_html: I was hoping more in-depth data modeling and real challenge. This was pretty basic course. Section 9 was something that I was looking for more.

reviews.content:
Very basic yet fundamental. Not a lot of practice, mostly examples. I recommend this course to those who are making their very first steps with SQL. Be aware that the content is heavily duplicated for 2 platforms: PostgreSQL and MS Server SQL so the total content of the course to actually learn is half of the hours than those in the description.
Pros:
1. The instructors are clear and succinct.
2. Good basic tips that will save you later on.
3. Real world databases to work with to get a solid impression.

Cons:
1. Does not cover what you need for an actual interview.
2. Imoprtant (NOT advanced) features of SQL like "Having", "In/Not in", Aggregation Functions, Triggers, Functions, Views and Security are not covered.
3. No real problems to solve, simple quizes with obvious answers so there is no real "doing".

The course is outdated, and the vary basics of the work environment are not explained, so you might encounter a lot of technical problems, but hey, that's just the way it is :).

Overall, the course is useful to get an overall picture of the subject.
reviews.content_html:
Very basic yet fundamental. Not a lot of practice, mostly examples. I recommend this course to those who are making their very first steps with SQL. Be aware that the content is heavily duplicated for 2 platforms: PostgreSQL and MS Server SQL so the total content of the course to actually learn is half of the hours than those in the description.
Pros:
1. The instructors are clear and succinct.
2. Good basic tips that will save you later on.
3. Real world databases to work with to get a solid impression.

Cons:
1. Does not cover what you need for an actual interview.
2. Imoprtant (NOT advanced) features of SQL like "Having", "In/Not in", Aggregation Functions, Triggers, Functions, Views and Security are not covered.
3. No real problems to solve, simple quizes with obvious answers so there is no real "doing".

The course is outdated, and the vary basics of the work environment are not explained, so you might encounter a lot of technical problems, but hey, that's just the way it is :).

Overall, the course is useful to get an overall picture of the subject.

reviews.content: I am gaining  knowledge to perform tasks efficiently
reviews.content_html: I am gaining knowledge to perform tasks efficiently

reviews.content: Good explanation of the basics.  I like the combination MSSQL and PostgreSQL demos and exercises.
reviews.content_html: Good explanation of the basics. I like the combination MSSQL and PostgreSQL demos and exercises.

reviews.content:
Good course in that it covers two SQL versions. But concepts are explained twice from the same script, so it's clear that this was meant to be two courses and they were combined without editing that would have added understanding.

Everything was well explained.
reviews.content_html:
Good course in that it covers two SQL versions. But concepts are explained twice from the same script, so it's clear that this was meant to be two courses and they were combined without editing that would have added understanding.

Everything was well explained.

reviews.content: Not as well delivered as other courses I’ve taken.
reviews.content_html: Not as well delivered as other courses I’ve taken.

courses.title: Learning Python for Data Analysis and Visualization
courses.smallDescription: Learn python and how to use it to analyze,visualize and present data. Includes tons of sample code and hours of video!
courses.author: Jose Portilla

instructors.name: Jose Portilla
instructors.job: Head of Data Science at Pierian Training
instructors.description:
Jose Marcial Portilla has a BS and MS in Mechanical Engineering from Santa Clara University and years of experience as a professional instructor and trainer for Data Science, Machine Learning and Python Programming. He has publications and patents in various fields such as microfluidics, materials science, and data science. Over the course of his career he has developed a skill set in analyzing data and he hopes to use his experience in teaching and data science to help other people learn the power of programming, the ability to analyze data, and the skills needed to present the data in clear and beautiful visualizations. Currently he works as the Head of Data Science for Pierian Training and provides in-person data science and python programming training courses to employees working at top companies, including General Electric, Cigna, The New York Times, Credit Suisse, McKinsey and many more. Feel free to check out the website link to find out more information about training offerings.

Show less

syllabus: Have an intermediate skill level of Python programming.
Use the numpy library to create and manipulate arrays.
Learn how to work with various data formats within python, including: JSON,HTML, and MS Excel Worksheets.
Have a portfolio of various data analysis projects.
Use the Jupyter Notebook Environment.
Use the pandas module with Python to create and structure data.
Create data visualizations using matplotlib and the seaborn modules with python.
requirements: Have a computer (either Mac, Windows, or Linux)

more.name: Intro to Data Project - Stock Market Analysis
Data Project - Stock Market Analysis Part 1
Data Project - Stock Market Analysis Part 2
Data Project - Stock Market Analysis Part 3
Data Project - Stock Market Analysis Part 4
Data Project - Stock Market Analysis Part 5
Data Project - Intro to Election Analysis
Introduction to Machine Learning with SciKit Learn
Multi Class Classification Part 1 - Logistic Regression
Multi Class Classification Part 2 - k Nearest Neighbor
SQL WILDCARDS, ORDER BY, GROUP BY and Aggregate Functions

reviews.content:
Rich is a super teacher. He explained everything very good. The course is motivating and the excercises are apropriate for the particular subject without being boring. 
I learned a lot and the learning speed in the course is excellent. Rich has chosen a perfect depth of the new skills he explained in every section. There is never too less or the too much.
I came from another course that i did not end, because the practices did not fit me, it was to boring. But different people are for different courses. Give Rich a try. It is worth it.
Now i have to begin part 2. Im looking forward to this.

[sorry for mistakes in this text. im not in english native speaker :) ]

reviews.content: Other teachers have made me feel not good enough for making mistakes or for not falling in line with precise instructions immediately. Rich makes me feel like I'm okay to make mistakes and my modest beginnings are good enough for a start.
reviews.content_html: Other teachers have made me feel not good enough for making mistakes or for not falling in line with precise instructions immediately. Rich makes me feel like I'm okay to make mistakes and my modest beginnings are good enough for a start.

reviews.content: Me pareció muy entretenido, enseña muchas cosas básicas y tiene muchos ejercicios que son muy entretenidos para practicar
reviews.content_html: Me pareció muy entretenido, enseña muchas cosas básicas y tiene muchos ejercicios que son muy entretenidos para practicar

reviews.content: great for the beginner with detailed easy explanations and plenty of opportunity to practice the exercises
reviews.content_html: great for the beginner with detailed easy explanations and plenty of opportunity to practice the exercises

reviews.content: I am pleased with this course. It was exactly what I have been looking for and exactly what I was told it would be. I liked it very much and I'm looking forward to the next courses and learn more about drawing!
reviews.content_html: I am pleased with this course. It was exactly what I have been looking for and exactly what I was told it would be. I liked it very much and I'm looking forward to the next courses and learn more about drawing!

reviews.content:
I'd prefer more structure in lectures. Sometimes I had a feeling that instructor doesn't know what he is going to talk about. And there times when the teacher is like "oh, look, I made a mistake, ha-ha, you see I can make mistakes too". It's fine first 2-3 times, but then it just becomes annoying.
But I guess that for some people his style of teaching is more suitable.
reviews.content_html:
I'd prefer more structure in lectures. Sometimes I had a feeling that instructor doesn't know what he is going to talk about. And there times when the teacher is like "oh, look, I made a mistake, ha-ha, you see I can make mistakes too". It's fine first 2-3 times, but then it just becomes annoying.
But I guess that for some people his style of teaching is more suitable.

reviews.content: I never had a good art teacher in my whole life. I love the foundations provided in this course, pretty helpful. Thanks!
reviews.content_html: I never had a good art teacher in my whole life. I love the foundations provided in this course, pretty helpful. Thanks!

reviews.content: Very useful for beginners, easy to follow and understand the lessons in simple explanations for those who feel intimidated by drawing but would like to hone their skills and become better artists right from start. Enough opportunities to practise sketching and drawing lines, basic forms and organic shapes. This course really makes you comfortable as a total beginner to improve your skills from zero. You build confidence with simplicity. I needed this course as a total beginner and I'm really happy to have signed up for it.

Enough opportunities to practise sketching and drawing lines, basic forms and organic shapes. This course really makes you comfortable as a total beginner to improve your skills from zero. You build confidence with simplicity. I needed this course as a total beginner and I'm really happy to have signed up for it.

reviews.content: Excellent course, highly recommended
reviews.content_html: Excellent course, highly recommended

reviews.content: I have learned so much from the instructor in a linear way where I can really track progress. This is exactly what I was looking for as an adult with no drawing skills but a desire to improve!
reviews.content_html: I have learned so much from the instructor in a linear way where I can really track progress. This is exactly what I was looking for as an adult with no drawing skills but a desire to improve!

reviews.content: Very friendly for beginners :), the instructor is awesome and a great motivator as well.
reviews.content_html: Very friendly for beginners :), the instructor is awesome and a great motivator as well.

reviews.content: I was expecting more information with real time drawing and not using digital tools to teach.The instructor says it’s a traditional course but doesn’t use any traditional tool to demonstrate any assignment.The section on shadow doesn’t explain anything else other than caste shadow.There we’re so many unsatisfactory moments through the lessons, not worthy of my time and money.I am sorry that I spend my money on this course.Too much waste of time………

courses.title: Python for Beginners - Learn Programming from scratch
courses.smallDescription: Python For Beginners : This course is meant for absolute beginners in programming or in python.
courses.author: Edwin Diaz, Coding Faculty Solutions

instructors.name: Edwin Diaz
instructors.description:
Edwin Diaz is a software and web technologies engineer, a life coach trainer who is also a serial entrepreneur with multiple online businesses, ranging from online jewelry shops, affiliate websites, application development and consultations services, personal online schools, etc.

With over one million students, and clients growing by the thousands a day, Mr. Diaz lets the numbers speak for themselves.

Founding multiple online companies have allowed Mr. Diaz to have the time to teach others. He currently teaches web technologies on different online platforms. He also teaches life coaching sessions to help others achieve a high level of success in many areas of life.

For Mr. Diaz, there is nothing more rewarding than helping others become successful.

His ability to transmit energy, enthusiasm, and complex knowledge allows him to do what he does best "Teach".

Teaching is not just a job for Mr. Diaz but a way of life that continues to flourish every single day.

Apart from teaching he enjoys spending part of his time with his family.

Show less

instructors.name: Coding Faculty Solutions
instructors.description: Coding Faculty creates high quality technology training content. We aim to teach technology the right way but at the same time putting emphasis on each of our students. We are a growing team of professional trainers who love our work but overall helping our students reach their maximum potential in their career.

syllabus: Create their own Python Programs
Become an experienced Python Programmer
Parse the Web and Create their own Games

reviews.content: Sometimes the concepts have NOT been explained clearly in the course.  The course flow can be organized in a better way rather than jumping among different topics.
reviews.content_html: Sometimes the concepts have NOT been explained clearly in the course. The course flow can be organized in a better way rather than jumping among different topics.

reviews.content:
The content is very broad and useful. Although I was preparing just for the cloud practitioner certification, I watched all sections. The vast majority of videos were very understandable and I had no issues with them.

The reason why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that some videos are a bit outdated (AWS console got some UI updates and following steps in videos/labs was not always easy) and could be structured better (there were cases when in one section I saw a video part two and in the next one there were the first part; besides, in the last section most videos are duplicated from previous sections, putting them in a separate category would be much better)
reviews.content_html:
The content is very broad and useful. Although I was preparing just for the cloud practitioner certification, I watched all sections. The vast majority of videos were very understandable and I had no issues with them.

The reason why I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that some videos are a bit outdated (AWS console got some UI updates and following steps in videos/labs was not always easy) and could be structured better (there were cases when in one section I saw a video part two and in the next one there were the first part; besides, in the last section most videos are duplicated from previous sections, putting them in a separate category would be much better)

reviews.content: Took the sample certification test, reviewed the things I didn't know, then passed the exam first try.
reviews.content_html: Took the sample certification test, reviewed the things I didn't know, then passed the exam first try.

reviews.content: Some parts need to be updated, especially a couple of the more advanced labs. Otherwise, a very comprehensive and easy to grasp course.
reviews.content_html: Some parts need to be updated, especially a couple of the more advanced labs. Otherwise, a very comprehensive and easy to grasp course.

reviews.content:
I am still going through the course videos and so far from what I have learnt this course is not just designed for passing an exam. It gives you real live examples and reasons as well as  explanations. The instructor aim is to make you learn what is required on the job and the concepts needed along the way. I have done  previous course already but decided to learn from another instructor .I can say have not regretted buying this course!
I will recommend it to any one!
reviews.content_html:
I am still going through the course videos and so far from what I have learnt this course is not just designed for passing an exam. It gives you real live examples and reasons as well as explanations. The instructor aim is to make you learn what is required on the job and the concepts needed along the way. I have done previous course already but decided to learn from another instructor .I can say have not regretted buying this course!
I will recommend it to any one!

reviews.content: hands on lab are very helpful and useful.
reviews.content_html: hands on lab are very helpful and useful.

reviews.content: Not up to date for AWS SAA; it's probably good for AWS CCP
reviews.content_html: Not up to date for AWS SAA; it's probably good for AWS CCP

reviews.content:
A Very Nice Explanation 
Especially the Lab sessions were very understandable..
reviews.content_html:
A Very Nice Explanation
Especially the Lab sessions were very understandable..

reviews.content: It would help to give regular feedback on how far from the certification test the level of detail for the current section is.
reviews.content_html: It would help to give regular feedback on how far from the certification test the level of detail for the current section is.

reviews.content: nm mn n        nm mnbmbmbmb
reviews.content_html: nm mn n nm mnbmbmbmb

reviews.content: This is an old course and talks about the services back in 2017. But if you are just here for the information, go for it. However, if you want to pass the exam in 2022 or onwards, buy the latest and updated versions.
reviews.content_html: This is an old course and talks about the services back in 2017. But if you are just here for the information, go for it. However, if you want to pass the exam in 2022 or onwards, buy the latest and updated versions.

reviews.content: Covers a lot. It over prepares you which is not a bad thing. If you UNDERSTAND (emphasis on understand) what he is teaching, you should do well on the exams. Of course, try your hands on practice questions too before the exam.
reviews.content_html: Covers a lot. It over prepares you which is not a bad thing. If you UNDERSTAND (emphasis on understand) what he is teaching, you should do well on the exams. Of course, try your hands on practice questions too before the exam.

Parse the Web and Create their own Games

more.name: Creating a Graph from a File

courses.description:
Do you want to become a programmer? Do you want to learn how to create games, automate your browser, visualize data, and much more?
If you’re looking to learn Python for the very first time or need a quick brush-up, this is the course for you!
Python has rapidly become one of the most popular programming languages around the world. Compared to other languages such as Java or C++, Python consistently outranks and outperforms these languages in demand from businesses and job availability. The average Python developer makes over $100,000 - this number is only going to grow in the coming years.
The best part? Python is one of the easiest coding languages to learn right now. It doesn’t matter if you have no programming experience or are unfamiliar with the syntax of Python. By the time you finish this course, you'll be an absolute pro at programming!
This course will cover all the basics and several advanced concepts of Python. We’ll go over:
  • The fundamentals of Python programming
  • The fundamentals of Python programming
  • The fundamentals of Python programming
  • The fundamentals of Python programming

If you read the above list and are feeling a bit confused, don’t worry! As an instructor and student on Udemy for almost 4 years, I know what it’s like to be overwhelmed with boring and mundane. I promise you’ll have a blast learning the ins and outs of python. I’ve successfully taught over 200,000+ students from over 200 countries jumpstart their programming journeys through my courses.
Here’s what some of my students have to say:
  • “I wish I started programming at a younger age like Avi. This Python course was excellent for those that cringe at the thought of starting over from scratch with attempts to write programs once again. Python is a great building language for any beginner programmer. Thank you Avi!”
courses.WhoThisCourse: • Even if you haven't touched coding before, it won't matter. The easy step-to-step lectures will quickly guide you through everything you'll need to know about coding, mainly Python. This course is here for you to get accustomed and familiar with Python and its syntax. And above all, Python is one of the easiest coding languages to learn, and there's a lot you can do with it.
